author: andschwa
body:
PowerShell is going to need to support file globbing for native commands, like:

``` powershell
gcc *.c
```

That scenario should probably work.

/cc @BrucePay @lzybkr

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Usability sync has floated a few proposals: 
- If we're running a native command, use globbing by default
- Have an environment variable to enable globbing
- Introduce a single character (like `^`) that falls into globbing

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is related to #1081. PowerShell needs much improved logic for handling globbing and escape characters (and they're intrinsically tied togther).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors I'm going to take this on.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is implemented in #2325, but the issue has been usurped by RFC 9, please see https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-RFC/issues/33. Closing.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: Reopening to track the need for a revised RFC.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
